channel.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
channel.description:
So, here we are again. I bet this thread looks familiar already, but... Anyway :stuck_out_tongue: [COLOR='Red']The very top of my budget is £450 ($700usd)
[b]Case:[/b] [url='https://www.ebuyer.com/product/172779#']Casecom 6788 Black Mid Tower, 120mm Blue Front Fan[/url] [b]-- £26 ($40usd)[/b] [b]Psu:[/b] [url='https://www.scan.co.uk/Products/750W-Powercool-80plus-Dual-12v-Rail-V22-High-Efficiency-Black-Psu#ProductFeatures']750W Powercool 80+ Dual 12v Rail V2.2 High Efficiency[/url] [b]-- £47 ($74usd)[/b] [b]Motherboard:[/b] ? [b]Processor:[/b] Intel Core 2 Quad Q8200 4 x 2.33Ghz [b]-- £104 (£163usd)[/b] [b]Ram: [/b]Kingston 2gb (2x1gb) Ddr2 1066mhz [b]-- £25 ($40usd)[/b] [b]Gpu:[/b] [url='https://www.videocardshop.co.uk/product.asp?session=@@@@@@@@@@@@AQYHFR748184-0UTCQS@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@&prodid=HD-485X-ZDFC&source=froogle']XFX HD4850 1Gb[/url] [b]-- £76 ($120usd)[/b] [b]Hdd:[/b] [url='https://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=HD-208-SE&groupid=701&catid=14&subcat=940']750Gb Seagate Barracuda[/url] [b]-- £59 ($92usd)[/b] [b]DVD drive:[/b] [url='https://www.lambda-tek.com/componentshop/index.pl?origin=gbase20.4&prodID=B89998']Samsung 20x dvd-rw[/url][b] -- £9 ($15usd)[/b]
[COLOR='Red']Total (-mobo) = £346 ($543usd)
-------------------------------------------------- A few things;
[b]1--[/b] Graphics card wise, I also [url='https://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=GX-017-C3&groupid=701&catid=56&subcat=1673']saw this[/url] just now, is it worth halving the memory and getting a HD5000 card? I'd say no, but it's worth asking.
[b]2--[/b] Yes, yes, I know using a quad is old hardware, but I'm on a very tight budget, so overclocking and cheap future upgrades are important.
[b]3--[/b] Yes, YES :hmph:. I know there's not much ram, but that's an easy place to save money, because more can always be added. :slight_smile: These past 2 points are obvious things people will point out, but I'm not completely blind or stupid, there are reasons.
[b]4--[/b] I do need some help picking a motherboard, they have me completely baffled. It'd have to be fairly durable and have features if everything attatched to it will be OC'd at some point, but again, price wise, I don't wanna stray over about £65 ($102usd)
Naturally, advice is welcomed .

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
I’m pretty sure you can still unlock core’s, but as I wrote it before, some core’s are locked for a reason, so don’t get annoyed when your system gets unstable with unlocked cores.
you’ll have to try which core’s are useable and which are broken

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
That mobo is quite alot more :S I’ve heard you can only unlock some of the older cpu’s, they’ve since changed something? But I’m not too bothered if I can’t Also, I know the board I picked doesn;t support any form of crossfire/sli Again, I’m not too bothered there. It’s not likely I’ll ever have the money to double up

So, final spec is;

Case: Casecom 6788 Black Mid Tower, 120mm Blue Front Fan – £26
Psu: 750W Powercool 80+ Dual 12v Rail V2.2 High Efficiency – £47
Motherboard: Asus M4A77D, AMD 770 – £60
Processor: AMD Phenom x2 550 Black Edition – £71
Ram: Kingston 2gb (2x1gb) Ddr2 1066mhz – £25
Gpu: HD4850 1Gb – £80
Hdd: 750Gb Seagate Barracuda – £59
DVD drive: Samsung 20x dvd-rw – £9

TOTAL: £377[/SIZE]

Monitor and keyboard/mouse is not a problem, I’ll get on that myself. Thanks for all the help guys

Siggs
.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
he’s searching mainboard for an [COLOR=‘Green’]AMD [COLOR=‘Red’]NOT [COLOR=‘DeepSkyBlue’]Intel

@siggs: I think yes, but check if this mobo can unlock cpu cores

EDIT: yes it can

btw, I spend some more money and bought this, it can disable, enable and unlock cores

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
sersoft:

The specs of your PC would be just as unrelated to the topic as the post you just made.

Thread Title:

ITT: Siggs PC planning

I can haz cookie now rite?

An ASUS P5E or P5Q would be a cheap, reliable 775 mobo. I used to have a P5E and I can personally say thats its a great mobo for overclocking and it can support two vid cards @ x16 speed, but it only supports CrossfireX.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
eternalness:

Should I feel accomplished that I haven’t posted my specs yet in this thread?

Yes, very. Have a cookie. You can have 2 if don’t mention them replying to this post too

EDIT: Guys, reckon this board will do the job? https://www.scan.co.uk/Products/Asus-M4A77D-AMD-770-S-AM3-PCI-E-(x16)-DDR2-1200(OC)-SATA-II-SATA-RAID-ATX

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
You can’t go wrong with ASUS, just get a board with 4 dimm slots so that when you’re upgrading the memory, you don’t have to throw out your old ram.

I made the mistake of getting the cheapest mobo possible and now I’m stuck with only 2 slots and I have to use expensive ram in order to keep my CPU overclocked to the max.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Ok…

Case: Casecom 6788 Black Mid Tower, 120mm Blue Front Fan – £26
Psu: 750W Powercool 80+ Dual 12v Rail V2.2 High Efficiency – £47
Motherboard: Gigabyte GA-MA790X-UD3P AMD 790X – £86
Processor: AMD Phenom x2 550 Black Edition – £71
Ram: Kingston 2gb (2x1gb) Ddr2 1066mhz – £25
Gpu: HD4850 1Gb – £80
Hdd: 750Gb Seagate Barracuda – £59
DVD drive: Samsung 20x dvd-rw – £9

TOTAL: £403

The only thing I want to change now is a slightly cheaper motherboard. Like people have said, Asus is tempting. Sorry to leach of you guys, but I lose the plot when it comes to mobos, I have no idea.
.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
AndrewJ:

Personally I think a Phenom550 is worth a look
3.6Ghz , stock voltages and HS/F np
If you unlock to Quad (I did 6 so far, 100% success ) @3.1GHz they run like a Phenom940 but
lower temps.

The 770/790x boards are not dear
If you get AM3/DDR3 you have upgrade path
775 is all but finished.

I love the support from you guys, but sifting through different opinions can be a bitch

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
dude, i care deeply for your bargain-basement PC gratification, so I implore you to follow my advice. If you get a 555 BE instead of a 550, you’ll not only be able to save $100 but you’ll also have a good chance of magically transforming it into a quadcore cpu:

https://www.anandtech.com/cpuchipsets/showdoc.aspx?i=3730

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Siggs PC planning
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
felcon:

I’m sorry to say this, but my pc is 2.5 years old atm and it still beats that.

I’m sorry that you feel the need to wave your e-penis in here like a dickhead, instead of being helpful Your PC cost a fair bit more, I’m willing to bet yes?

Anyway, I’ve decided on the AMD phenom x2 550 Black Edition, it’s cheaper than the Q8200 anyway, by quite alot But this would mean AM3, and more expensive ram?
.

Read full topic

Most of my parts are over 2 years old as well and my PC sure as hell beats that.

Except the CPU, but only at stock, 2.98ghz stable with speedstep disabled FTW.

Also, sorry siggs but I only steal cards for myself, and my local best-buy only has shitty cards on display so I won’t bother until they get the 5870…
